Literature Review: Food fraud represents a significant threat to the integrity of the global agri-food marketing system, with far-reaching consequences for consumers, producers, and policymakers. The complex interplay of factors that enable fraudulent activity in agri-food supply chains has been extensively studied, and recent efforts to document and deter food fraud have gained momentum. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the current state of knowledge on food fraud, its causes, consequences, and deterrence strategies.
